features_available: 🔮 Real Case Outcome Analysis (based on legal elements)
⚡ Real Document Risk Scanner (Australian law patterns)

legal_requirements: Duty of care must be established between parties
Breach of duty by falling below reasonable standard
Causation linking breach to harm (factual and legal)
Actual damage or loss suffered by plaintiff
legal_analysis.analysis_summary: Weak case with significant gaps in legal elements.

case_outcome_analysis.jurisdiction_notes: NSW courts generally follow established precedents. Strong emphasis on procedural fairness.
key_legal_issues: Duty of care establishment may be disputed
evidence_requirements: Expert testimony on standard of care

risk_analysis.overall_risk_level: HIGH - Significant amendments required before signing

identified_risks.legal_reference: Civil Liability Acts limit liability in tort but not contract
identified_risks.location:
...          
                    contractor accepts unlimited liability for any breach of this contract including consequ...

identified_risks.legal_reference: Unfair Contract Terms Act may apply to standard form contracts
identified_risks.location: ...           the contractor agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the client from any and all claims, damages, losses, costs and expens...

financial_exposure_assessment.assessment: CRITICAL: Unlimited liability could result in millions in exposure; HIGH: Significant financial risk from broad obligations; Contract value and commercial context determine exposure scale

recommended_amendments.recommended_amendment: Add liability cap: "The total liability of either party under this agreement shall not exceed the total amount paid under this agreement in the 12 months preceding the claim."
recommended_amendments.legal_basis: Standard practice to limit exposure; Civil Liability Acts provide guidance

recommended_amendments.recommended_amendment: Make indemnity mutual and limit scope: "Each party indemnifies the other against claims arising from its negligent acts, excluding liability for consequential damages."
recommended_amendments.legal_basis: Unfair Contract Terms Act may void one-sided indemnities

compliance_issues: Unfair Contract Terms provisions may void certain clauses
priority_actions: 🚨 IMMEDIATE: Do not sign until critical liability issues are resolved
📝 URGENT: Negotiate amendments for high-risk clauses
👨‍💼 Engage qualified legal counsel for review
risk_analysis.disclaimer: Risk analysis based on Australian legal principles. Obtain specific legal advice.

timing_considerations: Early settlement often achieves 70-80% of trial value with certainty
Post-discovery settlements typically higher due to evidence clarity
Door-of-court settlements can be 90%+ of expected trial outcome
Consider opposing party's financial position and litigation appetite
Trial costs and time investment favor settlement for smaller claims
settlement_analysis.disclaimer: Settlement estimates based on general factors. Actual outcomes depend on specific circumstances.
